name: Platform Foundation ROLES/RACI/RBAC Ontology Glossary
description: Comprehensive glossary of all terms, entities, properties, and relationships in the ROLES/RACI/RBAC ontology

hasDefinedTerm.name: Executive Role
hasDefinedTerm.description: A C-Suite or senior executive position with strategic accountability within an organization. Executive roles are filled by INDIVIDUALS and define high-level responsibilities, strategic focus areas, and alignment with organizational frameworks like VSOM and Balanced Scorecard.
hasDefinedTerm.usageExample: CEO (Chief Executive Officer) is an ExecutiveRole in the 'Core Traditional CSuite' category with strategic focus on 'Corporate Leadership & Vision'
hasDefinedTerm.usageContext: Use ExecutiveRole when defining C-Suite positions and senior leadership roles that have strategic accountability. ExecutiveRoles are typically seniorityLevel=1.
hasDefinedTerm.businessMeaning: Represents the highest level of organizational leadership positions that set strategic direction, make major decisions, and are accountable for business outcomes.
hasDefinedTerm.technicalMeaning: A class extending schema:OrganizationalRole with properties for roleCode, roleCategory, strategicFocus, VSOM alignment, BSC perspective, key frameworks, and metrics.
constraints: roleCode must be 2-5 uppercase letters (e.g., CEO, CMO)
roleCategory must be one of 7 defined CSuite categories
seniorityLevel for C-Suite roles should be 1
relationships: May have reportsTo relationships to other ExecutiveRoles
Has collaboratesWith relationships for matrix management
hasDefinedTerm.aiAgentUsage: AI agents query ExecutiveRoles to understand organizational leadership structure, identify strategic accountability, resolve RACI assignments, and determine authorization through RBAC policies.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Functional Role
hasDefinedTerm.description: An operational or functional position below executive level, typically within a specific department or function. Functional roles are filled by INDIVIDUALS and report to ExecutiveRoles.
hasDefinedTerm.usageExample: Marketing Manager is a FunctionalRole in the Marketing function with seniorityLevel=3 that reports to the CMO
hasDefinedTerm.usageContext: Use FunctionalRole for non-executive positions that perform operational work within specific functional areas.
hasDefinedTerm.businessMeaning: Represents day-to-day operational roles that execute strategy and perform functional activities within departments.
hasDefinedTerm.technicalMeaning: A class extending schema:EmployeeRole with properties for function, roleTitle, and seniorityLevel.
constraints: function must be from predefined list (Marketing, Sales, Operations, etc.)
seniorityLevel typically 2-10
Should have reportsTo relationship to an ExecutiveRole or higher-level FunctionalRole
relationships: Reports to ExecutiveRole or another FunctionalRole via reportsTo
hasDefinedTerm.aiAgentUsage: AI agents use FunctionalRoles to understand operational structure, resolve reporting relationships, determine task ownership, and evaluate permissions.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Role Assignment
hasDefinedTerm.description: Assignment of an INDIVIDUAL (schema:Person) to a ROLE within an ORGANIZATION context. This is the bridge entity that connects real people to organizational positions and enables multi-venture role portfolios.
hasDefinedTerm.usageExample: Amanda Moore (INDIVIDUAL) is assigned to CEO role (ExecutiveRole) at BAIV (Organization) with assignmentType='Primary' and timeCommitment=80%
hasDefinedTerm.usageContext: Use RoleAssignment whenever an INDIVIDUAL fills a ROLE in an ORGANIZATION. One person can have multiple RoleAssignments across different organizations.
hasDefinedTerm.businessMeaning: Represents the actual staffing of organizational positions - who is doing which job in which company.
hasDefinedTerm.technicalMeaning: A reified relationship entity linking schema:Person to pf:ExecutiveRole or pf:FunctionalRole within a schema:Organization context, with temporal and commitment attributes.
constraints: Each RoleAssignment must reference exactly one INDIVIDUAL, one ROLE, and one ORGANIZATION
If isActive=true, endDate must be null (BR-004)
Total timeCommitment across active assignments for a person should not exceed 100% (BR-005, warning)
assignmentType must be from predefined list
relationships: Links to INDIVIDUAL via individual property
Links to ROLE via assignedRole property
Links to ORGANIZATION via inOrganization property
Creates effective permission inheritance for USERS
hasDefinedTerm.aiAgentUsage: AI agents use RoleAssignment to resolve who currently holds which roles, determine permission inheritance for USERS, analyze capability coverage, and generate organizational charts. Critical for authorization queries.

hasDefinedTerm.name: RACI Assignment
hasDefinedTerm.description: Defines who is Responsible, Accountable, Consulted, or Informed for a specific activity or process. RACI assignments are made to ROLES, not directly to INDIVIDUALS.
hasDefinedTerm.usageExample: For activity 'AI Strategy Development', CEO role has raciType='Accountable' and CAIO role has raciType='Responsible'
hasDefinedTerm.usageContext: Use RACIAssignment to define accountability for activities and processes. Each activity must have exactly one Accountable role and at least one Responsible role.
hasDefinedTerm.businessMeaning: Clarifies who does the work (Responsible), who owns the outcome (Accountable), who provides input (Consulted), and who stays informed (Informed) for each business activity.
hasDefinedTerm.technicalMeaning: Entity linking an activity/process to a ROLE with a raciType indicator. Enforces business rules for accountability clarity.
constraints: Each activity must have exactly one Accountable ROLE (BR-001)
Each activity must have at least one Responsible ROLE (BR-002)
raciType must be one of: Responsible, Accountable, Consulted, Informed
RACI assignments apply to ROLES, never directly to INDIVIDUALS (BR-009)
relationships: Links to activity via activity property
Links to ROLE via role property
May be organization-scoped via organization property
hasDefinedTerm.aiAgentUsage: AI agents query RACIAssignments to answer 'who is accountable/responsible for X?', validate RACI matrices, generate RACI reports, and trace accountability chains from strategy to execution.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Capability
hasDefinedTerm.description: An ability, skill, or competency that can be performed by a role or required for a role. Capabilities define what actions or activities a role should be able to perform.
hasDefinedTerm.usageExample: Strategic Planning is a Capability of capabilityType='Strategic' with proficiencyRequired='Expert' for CEO role
hasDefinedTerm.usageContext: Use Capability to define the skills and competencies required by roles. Helps with gap analysis and role definition.
hasDefinedTerm.businessMeaning: Represents the skills and abilities needed to successfully perform a role's responsibilities.
hasDefinedTerm.technicalMeaning: Entity extending schema:Action with properties for capabilityType, proficiencyRequired, and related frameworks.
constraints: capabilityType must be from predefined list (Technical, Business, Leadership, etc.)
proficiencyRequired must be: Basic, Intermediate, Advanced, or Expert
relationships: Required by ROLES via hasCapability relationship
hasDefinedTerm.aiAgentUsage: AI agents use Capabilities to assess organizational capability coverage, identify skill gaps, match people to roles, and recommend training needs.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Permission
hasDefinedTerm.description: Authorization to perform an action on a resource. Permissions are granted to USERS (not roles directly) through AccessPolicies that bind roles to permissions.
hasDefinedTerm.usageExample: Permission with action='Approve', resource='Budget', conditions=[amount<10000], effect='Allow'
hasDefinedTerm.usageContext: Use Permission to define what actions can be performed on what resources, with optional conditions. Permissions are packaged in AccessPolicies.
hasDefinedTerm.businessMeaning: Defines what actions users are allowed or denied to perform on specific resources, with contextual conditions.
hasDefinedTerm.technicalMeaning: Entity specifying action, resource, optional conditions, and effect (Allow/Deny). Core building block of RBAC system.
constraints: action must be from predefined list (Create, Read, Update, Delete, etc.)
resource is required
effect must be Allow or Deny
conditions are optional AccessCondition objects
hasDefinedTerm.aiAgentUsage: AI agents evaluate Permissions when resolving authorization queries. They check action, resource, conditions, and apply conflict resolution rules.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Access Policy
hasDefinedTerm.description: Binds ROLES to PERMISSIONS. This is the core RBAC mechanism - USERS who fill roles inherit the permissions defined in the AccessPolicies for those roles.
hasDefinedTerm.usageExample: AccessPolicy for CEO role grants permissions: [Approve Budget, Create Strategy, Read All Reports] with priority=100
hasDefinedTerm.usageContext: Use AccessPolicy to group permissions and assign them to roles. When a USER fills a role via RoleAssignment, they inherit the permissions from that role's AccessPolicies.
hasDefinedTerm.businessMeaning: Defines what a role is allowed to do in the system. Separates authorization from identity by using roles as the intermediary.
hasDefinedTerm.technicalMeaning: Entity linking a ROLE to a set of Permissions, with optional organization scope, priority for conflict resolution, and active status.
constraints: Must reference exactly one ROLE
Must grant at least one Permission
Priority is used for conflict resolution (higher wins)
Deny effect overrides Allow at same priority (BR-007)
Can be organization-scoped or global
relationships: Applies to ROLE via role property
Governs roles via inverse governedBy relationship
hasDefinedTerm.aiAgentUsage: AI agents traverse AccessPolicies to determine what a USER can do. Resolution: User -> Person -> RoleAssignments -> Roles -> AccessPolicies -> Permissions. Critical for authorization decisions.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Access Condition
hasDefinedTerm.description: A conditional constraint that must be satisfied for a permission to apply. Enables context-aware access control.
hasDefinedTerm.usageExample: AccessCondition with attribute='amount', operator='lessThan', value='10000' restricts approval permission to budgets under $10K
hasDefinedTerm.usageContext: Use AccessCondition to add contextual rules to permissions, such as value thresholds, time windows, or resource attributes.
hasDefinedTerm.businessMeaning: Allows fine-grained control where permissions depend on the context (e.g., amount, time, location).
hasDefinedTerm.technicalMeaning: Entity with attribute, operator, and value that evaluates to true/false at runtime.
constraints: operator must be from predefined list (equals, lessThan, greaterThan, contains, etc.)
All three properties (attribute, operator, value) are required
relationships: Attached to Permission via conditions property
hasDefinedTerm.aiAgentUsage: AI agents evaluate AccessConditions at runtime when checking permissions. If conditions fail, permission is denied even if policy would otherwise allow.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Has Role Assignment
hasDefinedTerm.description: Relationship linking an INDIVIDUAL (schema:Person) to their RoleAssignments. One person can have multiple RoleAssignments.
hasDefinedTerm.usageExample: Amanda Moore hasRoleAssignment [CEO at BAIV, Advisor at W4M]
hasDefinedTerm.usageContext: Use to navigate from a person to all their role assignments across organizations.
hasDefinedTerm.businessMeaning: Shows all the organizational positions a person currently or historically held.
hasDefinedTerm.technicalMeaning: One-to-many relationship from schema:Person to pf:RoleAssignment. Cardinality: 0..*
hasDefinedTerm.aiAgentUsage: AI agents use this to answer 'what roles does person X hold?' and to resolve permissions by finding active role assignments.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Reports To
hasDefinedTerm.description: Hierarchical reporting relationship between roles. Defines organizational structure and management chains.
hasDefinedTerm.usageContext: Use to define formal reporting relationships in organizational hierarchy. Must be acyclic (BR-003).
hasDefinedTerm.businessMeaning: Defines who a role reports to in the management hierarchy.
hasDefinedTerm.technicalMeaning: One-to-one relationship from Role to Role. Cardinality: 0..1. Must not create cycles.
constraints: Must not create circular reporting chains (BR-003)
A role can report to at most one other role
hasDefinedTerm.aiAgentUsage: AI agents use reportsTo to generate org charts, determine management chains, and validate organizational structure.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Collaborates With
hasDefinedTerm.description: Symmetric peer collaboration relationship between roles. Represents matrix management and cross-functional collaboration without hierarchy.
hasDefinedTerm.usageExample: CMO collaboratesWith CTO on digital marketing technology initiatives
hasDefinedTerm.usageContext: Use to model peer relationships and matrix management structures where roles work together without hierarchical reporting.
hasDefinedTerm.businessMeaning: Indicates roles that need to work together closely, share information, or coordinate activities.
hasDefinedTerm.technicalMeaning: Many-to-many symmetric relationship. If A collaboratesWith B, then B collaboratesWith A. Cardinality: 0..*
constraints: Symmetric relationship - must be bidirectional
hasDefinedTerm.aiAgentUsage: AI agents use collaboratesWith to identify stakeholders for activities, suggest who to consult, and map cross-functional collaboration patterns.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Has RACI Assignment
hasDefinedTerm.description: Relationship linking an activity or process to its RACI accountability assignments.
hasDefinedTerm.usageExample: Activity 'Develop AI Strategy' hasRACIAssignment [CEO=Accountable, CAIO=Responsible, CMO=Consulted, CFO=Informed]
hasDefinedTerm.usageContext: Use to link activities to their RACI definitions. Each activity should have complete RACI coverage.
hasDefinedTerm.businessMeaning: Defines who is responsible, accountable, consulted, and informed for an activity.
hasDefinedTerm.technicalMeaning: One-to-many relationship from Action to RACIAssignment. Cardinality: 1..*
constraints: Each activity must have at least one RACIAssignment (typically 2-4)
Must satisfy BR-001 (one Accountable) and BR-002 (at least one Responsible)
hasDefinedTerm.aiAgentUsage: AI agents traverse this relationship to answer accountability queries and generate RACI matrices.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Governed By
hasDefinedTerm.description: Relationship linking a role to the access policies that govern its permissions.
hasDefinedTerm.usageContext: Use to associate roles with their permission sets. USERS inherit permissions from policies governing their roles.
hasDefinedTerm.businessMeaning: Defines what permissions a role has through policies.
hasDefinedTerm.technicalMeaning: One-to-many relationship from Role to AccessPolicy. Cardinality: 0..*
hasDefinedTerm.aiAgentUsage: AI agents traverse governedBy to collect all policies for a role during permission resolution.
